title: Dąbrowa Chełmińska
text:
Dąbrowa Chełmińska () is a village in <a href="Bydgoszcz%20County">Bydgoszcz County</a>, <a href="Kuyavian-Pomeranian%20Voivodeship">Kuyavian-Pomeranian Voivodeship</a>, in north-central Poland. It is the seat of the <a href="gmina">gmina</a> (administrative district) called <a href="Gmina%20D%C4%85browa%20Che%C5%82mi%C5%84ska">Gmina Dąbrowa Chełmińska</a>. It lies east of <a href="Bydgoszcz">Bydgoszcz</a> and north-west of <a href="Toru%C5%84">Toruń</a>. It is located in <a href="Che%C5%82mno%20Land">Chełmno Land</a> within the historic region of <a href="Pomerania">Pomerania</a>.
The village has a population of 1,400.
History.
During the <a href="Occupation%20of%20Poland%20%281939%E2%80%931945%29">German occupation of Poland</a> (<a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>), Dąbrowa Chełmińska was one of the sites of executions of <a href="Poles">Poles</a>, carried out by the Germans in 1939 as part of the "<a href="Intelligenzaktion">Intelligenzaktion</a>". In 1942, the occupiers also carried out <a href="Expulsion%20of%20Poles%20by%20Nazi%20Germany">expulsions of Poles</a>, who were sent to transit and concentration camps in the region.
Sports.
The local <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club is LKS Dąbrowa Chełmińska. It competes in the lower leagues.
